p: Sirolimus (rapamycin) is a well-known geroprotector, known to effectively increase lifespan and slow aging in many species, including yeast [ 55, 56], Drosophila [ 57, 58], C. elegans [ 59], and mice [ 60– 64]. It also delays age-related diseases in humans [ 65– 68], and Blagosklonny proposed rapamycin for the prevention of multiple age-related diseases in humans [ 69– 72].
